bio.p: Aminu Yakubu is the Vice President for Research Planning and Ethics at 54Gene, an organization which focuses on inclusion of African populations in global genomics research. He was the pioneer Administrator to the Nigeria National Health Research Ethics Committee. He had postgraduate training in Bioethics from the Berman Institute of Bioethics, USA. He is interested in ethical issues relating to health systems, genomics research and research during outbreak situations.
